website_summaries.verdict: This rack can fit on any wall and provide extra shelving space and keep several pots easily accessible.
pros: Brackets adjust to fit your space
Holds well when mounted on the studs
Rated to hold 30 pounds, but appears to hold heavier pots very well
Wooden shelf provides a sturdy  place to hold lids or larger pots
cons: A little short on hooks with only six total and no hooks for utensils

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The unit is very nice and looks good in our kitchen. It took about 30 minutes to set up. Your provided with screws but no anchors to anchor it to the wall. You can use some good plastic wall anchors to attach it to the wall. The pots can be heavy so the unit has to be secured to the wall properly. The instructions are not the best but the unit is not hard to assemble. All in all, I love this product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Yakeem

customer_reviews.title: Good product if you have room to hang a small shelf
customer_reviews.text: I wish they made a larger one but I have to admit it fills it's niche role well. I recommend ordering some extra hooks if you have a lot of skillets and pans. It works well. My only two complaints are wishing it was a tad wider/deeper and that it doesn't have a flat shelf top because the bases of the pot hooks stick up like caps making the top shelf uneven. Still, it works for me as it is also very adjustable so those hooks can be moved around easily.
customer_reviews.author: Blithe

customer_reviews.title: Great pot rack. Replace the mounting screws.
customer_reviews.text: We recently remodeled our kitchen and wanted a great solution to pot storage. These racks were perfect with a small modification. They are easy to assemble. The racks themselves are well made but the mounting screws are inadequate. The installation is extremely sturdy IF you do two things: 1) Be sure the brackets are mounted directly to studs. 2) Replace the short 1 1/2 inch screws provided and use 2 1/2 inch cabinet mounting screws instead. We're very happy with the appearance and function.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to make one of these myself but when I saw this on Amazon it was a no brainer. Such a great price for what you are getting. I read some comments that said they only received a couple of the rotating hooks. All of my hooks rotate so maybe they changed that recently. If I did make one myself I would have made it two inches deeper but the time it would take for just about the same price make this product a win in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Great for small kitchens
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered two. It was supposed to be a Christmas gift for my mom, but I’m so glad I hit “buy now” twice! My kitchen is small, and this is the best for storing all of my pots and pans without taking up cabinet space. My boyfriend is a chef and has a plethora of cast iron skillets. This holds all of them, plus all of our pots with ease. I am never worried about adding weight.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy,  looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Hooks are big enough to hold pans with a hole in the handle (without a seperate hang tag). Metal is thick and sturdy. Don't expect the typical polished aliminium flimsy looking metal. Versatile can move hooks forward and backward depending for bigger or smaller pots/pans. (Can add or remove hooks without having to disassemble the unit. Looks great. (Instructions are a big vague but you'll figure it out, really quite easy to put together).
customer_reviews.author: Krizza.f

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not as much shelf space
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good quality product, easy to assemble, and looks great. Cons: The shelf doesn't fit as much as I'd hoped. The design of this makes for a gap between the shelf bracket and the wood shelf, the shelf is not flush against the bracket against the wall so there's less shelf space available. Also the way the hooks hang is they connect through the top, so each hook has a metal part that protrudes from the top of the shelf making usable shelf space even more scarce. If you place a pot on top it looks uneven and unbalanced. Didn't realize all this till it was already drilled onto the wall, I'm sure you can find better.
customer_reviews.author: Mahjecpandy

customer_reviews.title: Really easy installation, but design could be a little better ...
customer_reviews.text: Really easy installation, but design could be a little better with the hooks as the mechanism can make the surface of the shelf uneven and hazardous for lots of pots and lids. It depends on where you position the hooks. Attached to the top of the hooks are large round metal nubs that sit on the top of the shelf. The solution is that if you have the hooks hanging from the slits closer to you, then the nub will make the pots angled towards the wall (and safer), rather than angled towards you where it can easily fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack!  Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this rack! I was so surprised at the ease of use and the versatility. I hung the rack in my New kitchenette and it holds everything I was hoping and more! I even ordered an extra set of hooks because it had so much space. It is designed so that the pans don’t even hit the wall. I was worried they would scuff up the wall as they were hung, but they don’t even touch. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, minimal cons.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot rack. It’s great looking and very functional. The instructions were very minimal but it wasnt hard to assemble. The only problem we ran into was out houses studs are farther apart than the pre cut holes would work for, so we had to drill new holes which wasn’r difficult. Also other con is the hooks stick up a tad far on to the shelf which makes any pot you sit on top sit uneven or a bit wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey W

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan Rack!
customer_reviews.text: This went together very easily. I will warn you, if you are going to put it right up against another wall then you are going to have an extremely tough time putting that bracket into a stud with the way it is designed. So, for us one bracket is in the middle. However, with some quick zip tie work we made it so the shelf won't pull up out of the end bracket and it works amazingly well. I have 8 pans hanging from it no problem with 2 pots stored on top. It is very strong and looks stylish!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great small pot rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy pot rack. Like the fact you can move mounting bars to fit where your studs are in wall. I would not hang this into drywall at all, it needs and states in directions it is to be screwed into studs. It also came with 6 rotating hooks. Going to be Hung at our beach cottage where space is very limited.
customer_reviews.author: V M

customer_reviews.title: Happy home improvements
customer_reviews.text: I’m a picky read a 100 reviews, compare a 100 items before settling typa person. So it means a lot when I say I’m happy with the purchase. Very sturdy, looks great and cleared up storage space for me. I liked that the gray handle bars are easily adjustable from left to right so you can secure it to your wall studs. I have a tight space so I couldn’t secure it to my wall studs without it looking uneven. I bought (1/8” x 2”) toggle bolts to anchor to the drywall for sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: LMP

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Sturdy Pot Rack
customer_reviews.text: I was looking a way to hang my 12 inch Lodge Cast Iron Skillet (which weighs 10 pounds) on my wall and this works. It states that the max weight it can bear is 33 pounds, but I haven't tested it. A bit confusing to put together, but on the whole pretty simple. We used longer screws than provided to anchor the brackets to the wall. I love it and would buy it again, if my husband would let me.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Visco

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product, difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy and functional. I had it in one apartment, took it down and moved it to another. It frees up a lot of cabinet space. The only drawback is that it's a pain to put together. it's difficult to get the shelf level. Set aside some time to assemble it, you need 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: Alex White

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my kitchen. Compact, sturdy, adjustable mounting, holds my professional cookware and got them out of their hiding spot. Have a small kitchen and just perfect. My lady is a professional designer so she helped pic and place and she loves it. You can drill right into studs 18inch on center and secure the wooden racks accordingly(look closely at my pic) . No need to use drywall mounting, plastic hardware. If considering I’d buy it. Fun n easy to assemble and install.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Conte

customer_reviews.title: Nice but little top space
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and good for hanging pots and pans but this thing is useless for stacking things on the wooden part on top because the metal cooks protrude onto the top, creating a very uneven surface. You have to move them around to make space for even one or two pots. I ended up building a small wooden platform to put on top. Good buy unless you are planning to really utilize that top shelf space
customer_reviews.author: Tom Schmertz

customer_reviews.title: Look at others photos to determine how the finish product should look
customer_reviews.text: The assembly manual did not do a good job with describing the placement/distance of where to Put the wooden part and i ended up placing them too far apart which messed up the overall completion of the job But it was still good enough and sturdy enough to fulfill its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Durrell gresham

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pot rack!
customer_reviews.text: This pot rack is great. I have it holding 8 or so pots and pans. It's really nice looking and provides a good solution for not stacking them and ruining the nonstick coating. I wish the slats were a bit farther apart. We had the pot lids up there, held between the pot rack, and one good door slam sent one of them to the ground, shattering on impact. If the slats were a bit farther apart, they would have held better and not rolled off the edge. I also wish it came with more hooks. I had to buy 4 extra, and they aren't the cheapest things in the world (~$10 per 2 pack). But overall I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great item! Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Good quality rack and great customer service. The product has been updated and now comes with all swivel hooks instead of 4 pan hooks and 2 swivel. Their customer service was great when I contacted them about this and provided us with the hooks pictured because we needed non-swivel for some of our pans. Highly recommend the product, very study design and looks great
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install, takes back some counter space, and gives your kitchen a nice look.
customer_reviews.text: It came with instructions but you really could do without them, it's that simple. The only thing you really need to make sure of is that you drill into a stud if you plan on putting a good amount of weight on this thing. It comes with anchors but I feel more comfortable going into the stud and making sure I could a few pull ups from it if I wanted to. The wood is thin but holds up well, we even bought some extra hooks to add even more pans to it. Looks great and is super functional!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Capable of holding the heaviest of pots and pans
customer_reviews.text: This rack is 36" long. Most houses have wall studs on 16" centers, thus 32" center to center across 3 studs makes a perfect fit for installing this rack. The provided screws are perfect for securing the two extremely heavy duty support brackets. This holds very heavy pans with ease. I bought 2 additional swivel hooks, which makes a total of 8. The hooks are well designed and capable of holding any pot.
customer_reviews.author: Danaher M. Dempsey Jr.

customer_reviews.title: the construction is good and the quality is solid
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely rack, and bigger than I anticipated. The ONLY problem is that the installation instructions are basically non-existent. I am fairly adept at figuring things out, but there is absolutely no guidance regarding how this thing is put together (not even a schematic) and it's extremely frustrating. Other than that, the construction is good and the quality is solid.
customer_reviews.author: dr. parrot

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo good! Going strong after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to get this at first because of the price and how you practically have to buy several different holders to make a full rack, but they are really useful and it looks awesome! 3 year update: 3 years and 3 moves later and it still holds everything really well and sturdily even though I keep it fully packed with heavy pots and pans. The picture is from when I had just bought this and didn’t really trust its strength, but right now it holds about twice as many pans and all the smaller utensils went back to racks. It still looks great and the hooks look as good as new. This was a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small kitchens!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Wall mount pot and pan holder! This set up is great to hold your pots and pans and has plenty of room on top. It has two extra small hooks for easy use. It's easy to assemble and looks great. I give it five stars because it does exactly as advertised. Great shelf!!
customer_reviews.author: RAVenous Beast

customer_reviews.title: Great pot rack, easy assembly and installation, holds pans securely
customer_reviews.text: We love this pot rack. It's very well made and was very easy to put together and install. It holds our Emeril pans perfectly. The top rack is pretty narrow so we don't put any pans up there like the photo shows but rather just some decorative mugs. Very sturdy and attractive. Highly recommended. We added a pot lid holder also bought on Amazon that works very well. Will include photos of both.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, low-profile, and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I received this product quickly and in great shape but without any instructions whatsoever. Fortunately, it is pretty simple, and I had little difficulty figuring out how to mount it. I screwed both brackets into studs for added stability; the finished product is more than capable of bearing the weight of my pots and pans. The profile is pleasantly unobtrusive in small kitchen spaces like mine. I would recommend purchasing more hooks with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Vee

customer_reviews.title: Love the look
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with the way this looked. When we got it, I was pleased and fell in love with it even more. It is made really well and was not hard to put together and up. It looks great in our small kitchen. As soon as I have the rest of the pans cleaned and up on the rack, I will update the photo. As of now, it looks a little bare.
customer_reviews.author: CindyLouWho

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, sturdy, saves space
customer_reviews.text: I have a small kitchen and recently purchased a 14 piece all clad cookware set. I wanted to save space in my cupboards by hanging them up, and being able to display them as they’re very beautiful was a plus. The natural wood with steel accents on the shelf go very well with the pan set. The shelf feels sturdy and do well with all the weight- note, the all clad set is very heavy and I imagine would weigh over 40 lbs, if not 50 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: J.S

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: This shelf is sturdy! It was a little hard for me to screw in the right side... you have to put the screws in at a weird angle. The hooks come up and things don't rest flat if they are put in the top of the hooks. Those are my only complaints overall, I really love this product. it looks good and does the job. I purchased them almost 3 years ago and they are going on strong!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: Frees up space and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to free up cabinet space. Fairly easy to construct. At times, I wished I had a 2nd pair of hands but not a big deal. Ours is currently holding 8 heavier non stick conduction rated pans (3 on top and 5 hanging). Holds strong and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Harris

customer_reviews.title: A winning design with quality endurance
customer_reviews.text: The pot rack has a nice functional design, simple yet enduring. I hang my All Clad Stainless steel pans which are on the heavier side, with ease and no fear of the shelf coming down. One should have someone with skill to install. The shelf is used for lighter pots and small sauce pans, ideal for freeing up cabinet space. As far as pot racks go, I can't imagine a better one is on the market. I'd say t's one of the best purchases I've made in the past year.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scalisi

customer_reviews.title: A great wall rack..
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one of these about 10 years ago. When I sold my house, I had to leave the rack with it (apparently, anything permanently attached to the house had to go with it... huh). Well, I went about 2 weeks before ordering another one.. Perfect size, compact, sturdy, out of the way. A really great addition I couldn't live without.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin J Costantini

customer_reviews.title: good pot rack
customer_reviews.text: Good pot rack, fits 5 hung and 5 on top. Not the easiest to assemble into wall or into ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: the true Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Simple, beautiful and practical.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is pretty simple to set up if you have the right tools (stud finder, drill, level, measuring tape). It can be done with one person but two would be better. I like how sturdy the brackets are. They aren't flimsy, thin metal. I like that you can add more hooks if needed down the line. I set this up alone and it took me under an hour because I made some mistakes trying to use anchors instead of finding the studs. I would recommend this product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: jessica depena

customer_reviews.title: Great Shelf & Modifiable
customer_reviews.text: Took my handy guy about 30 minutes to install! We first painted the hardware gold to match the pulls on our cabinets. The Rustoleum we purchased ran a bit so maybe we should have sanded the pieces lightly first or sprayed a bit lighter and added coats. If not using it for a pan hanger we may use it to hang small plants.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: It's a pot rack with a shelf perfect for the Gap in between your cabinets in your kitchen. I just lasted a 7.0 earthquake without breaking or falling apart. I have mine not in the studs. But have wall mounts. Also it's something obnoxious shelf. So you can put it above your sink and you won't be hitting your head on pants.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew DiRoma

customer_reviews.title: game changer
customer_reviews.text: I had a handyman hang this in my pantry to free up cabinet space and I was worried about it being so close to electrical panel and hitting wires! It's a great product, well made and doesn't take up much space. I bought extra hooks so I could hand 10 pans. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: gracie v

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on the wall. However the slats are not graciously spaced, so capacity is somewhat limited. Not enough space to add additional hooks for more storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Looks great in the kitchen but it's a tad smaller than ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in the kitchen but it's a tad smaller than expected. it doesn't stick out too far from the wall so you can't set large pots on top. Everybody who sees it, loves it though!
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT BUT NOT THE HOOKS
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted this for so long. So glad we finally ordered it. I love having everything within reach. Love that it comes with the perfect amount of hooks. The only thing I am not fond of is how the hooks have tops that stick up on the shelf and pots cant sit flush because of it. Still love the product though and like that its so well made.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Girl

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed to say the least and IF it ever gets ...
customer_reviews.text: My Cooks Standard Wall Mounted Wooden Pot Rack came with NO ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS. I searched the internet looking to download assembly instructions but came up empty. I am very disappointed to say the least and IF it ever gets assembled and mounted, I may be satisfied with its functionality but the route to get there is torturous indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharran Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, but can't use the shelf.
customer_reviews.text: Love the pot rack, and the 2 swivel hooks are great. The only downside is that all the hooks are inserted from the top of the rack, so you really can't sit much on the shelf as it appears in the picture. The top of the hooks make the surface uneven, so the shelf is more for looks than functionality.
customer_reviews.author: D&L

customer_reviews.title: GORGEOUS
customer_reviews.text: Totally upped my kitchen game. Looks great. Just keep in mind you need to hang on studs or use wall grabby attachments which I ended up needing.
customer_reviews.author: Montana d.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and does the job. Mine is set in masonry wall with lead anchors so install was more involved but product assembles easily.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Metal hardware was all scratched up and dinged right out of the packaging. Wood is super super soft and is very easily dented! 30 lb weight limit!?! Stainless steel pots are heavy and I worry if this rack will hold a set. With all the good reviews I was excited about this product...never have I given a bad review but for $65 I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: mindy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. My wife and me have a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. My wife and me have a small house so we needed a little room and this does the trick. Easy to assemble but I recommend one other person helping. Also I used wall anchors to for some added measure.
customer_reviews.author: chris Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this shelf. I'm not using it to hang pots and pans, but it works perfectly in this odd space over my kitchen sink. Its very sturdy & looks fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: SO nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is SO nice and sturdy. Exactly what we were looking for and get many compliments. Buy extra hooks as I have had a couple of them fall out for no reason (with the pot on the hook). Not a fault of the pot rack but I do have extra hooks (especially the swivel ones) on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Nunu2

customer_reviews.title: unique, attractive, practical
customer_reviews.text: This is the second home I've outfitted with these racks. They are easy to assemble, can make room for a lot more pans/pots than the supplied hooks hold (and you can order more hooks), and keep your pans out where you can see them.
customer_reviews.author: drdi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Solved one of my big space problems in a kitchen with little storage space. Also gives me easy access to my beautiful All Clad cookware. This is a classic look, and with the addition of a set of extra hooks, it holds all of my cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Caterman

customer_reviews.title: I really like this. 5 starts worth with one tiny exception
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. 5 starts worth with one tiny exception. The hooks go through the slats and are raised above the top of the shelf making it hard to put a pot on the shelf. I managed to get one pot on there, and used the slats for my lids, so it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: mooser

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy nice looking rack, works really well !!
customer_reviews.text: Nice rack, fits the small space well where we have no pots and pans storage.
customer_reviews.author: VacationerSeattle

customer_reviews.title: Great product and purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. Very happy with the purchase. I used better screws tho that I bought at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: FranDon

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice easy setup brackets should be shiny, wood cheap pine should be oak. The movable pan holders are great but to store on top they get in the way, so have to buy extra wood pieces to store pots flat on top.
customer_reviews.author: Dale C. Laubach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs! Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We needed some space for all our pots and pans. I'm amazed at the great quality and how easy it was to install. Bought some extra hooks and paired it with Ikea VARIERA 701.548.00 Pot Lid Organizer, Stainless Steel. Its excellent for storing all our needs. I would highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for some thing to hang or store large pans because of lack of cabinet space and found this product. I have 6 large/medium sized pans hanging from it and they fit in and look perfect. It blended in quite well with my wood kitchen theme and does not look out of place. Make sure you attach them to studs. This attaches to studs spaced 32 inches apart which is pretty standard.
customer_reviews.author: Core.Slamnia

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and organized
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble and install. I have a small kitchen and had been struggling with storing all my pots and pans so this was a perfect fit. Love the design too! Keeps my kitchen looking modern and organized.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, well made
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, strong, well made. I hung three pots and three lids, plus a large ceramic pot and a brass teapot on the top shelf. It looks good and saves some valuable undercounted space.
customer_reviews.author: Country Doc

customer_reviews.title: Best rack for best price
customer_reviews.text: Best rack for best price! easy to install.. Watch for angeled drill drives om upper bracket holes. They are angled, not straight
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Durable. It's so nice to not have to bend down into cupboards for pots. I wish there was a way to safely store lids up here, too.
customer_reviews.author: Udoka Grace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came with more pot hooks and you didn't have to buy extra but besides that, this thing is perfect!! It's looks adorable on our kitchen wall, holds my pots and pans and a few things on top. Good solid materials.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations in both assembly and look.
customer_reviews.text: Once you locate the studs you should have this thing up on the wall in 15-20 minutes. It was so easy and I’m even happier with the look than I thought I would be. It’s perfect for what I had in mind. Also, those are some seriously heavy pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good pot rack
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to assemble and looks nice. Also ordered extra hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and a great product
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it and she stores her frying pans along with a few pots
customer_reviews.author: Phil Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pot rack easy to install took 15 minutes or less looks great in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Sleik

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver
customer_reviews.text: I saw this in a magazine and had to have it. I have a very small kitchen and this pot rack gives me more space to put other items into my cabinets. Plus since the pots hang on the wall they are much easier to get to now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Very easy to install & I like the hooks. One thing to note, the hooks hang from the top of the wood bars, so they do stick up a bit. This didn't hinder me, but may hinder others in what they put on top of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: nate wilcox

customer_reviews.title: The pot rack is perfect! We had to use anchors to mount it ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a very small apartment and need to capitalize on vertical space. The pot rack is perfect! We had to use anchors to mount it into the dry wall, studs weren't an option, but my boyfriend reports that it was not difficult to do. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ari Schnabel

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase. Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I put an oak plank (stained in golden oak) up behind this pot rack to provide a little extra support. I hid the screws by covering them up with the brackets. We use this to hang our cast iron cookware and it is solid, simple and gives our kitchen extra storage space. This was a great purchase. Solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Besides the fact that the instructions have so many grammatical errors, it was pretty simple to put together after looking at the image a few times. It was easy to put up and it's pretty sturdy. It appears to be made well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvis C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Looks great in our kitchen and built ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Looks great in our kitchen and built really well! I would recommend this for anyone wanting to use up some wall space in there kitchen. You won't be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Scowil

customer_reviews.title: Great pot rack
customer_reviews.text: Great pot rack, not a very good shelf. Shelf is very narrow and the hooks protrude out of the top not allowing for an even shelf surface. As a pot rack and for the price it cannot be beat. Looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy LaDucer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Smart!
customer_reviews.text: Item well packaged and protected. Arrived timely and reasonably priced. Mounted on studs and looks sharp in a small, recently installed, kitchen (of my design and furnishings!). Highly recommend the product and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Geek Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartments where you really need to max out ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift and my brother swears by the products sturdiness and reliability. Great for apartments where you really need to max out the functionality per square foot. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail. Looks awesome in the package. However it does not appear to have come with directions. However I have not opened it yet, so they may be hidden deep inside. Will re-post once it's put together. Shipped quickly and arrived unscathed. Looking forward to the extra storage. Longer then I expected, but I didn't really look at the dimensions first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful shelf; perfect for my wall above the sink. Great hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Currier

customer_reviews.title: They do NOT look like in the item photos
customer_reviews.text: The brackets and hooks are very poorly made, and look unfinished and raw. The seams from the cast weren't even sanded or ground down. They do NOT look like in the item photos. The brackets and hooks in the photos appear polished, the item received is not.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this! the instructions are non existent but not too hard to figure out
customer_reviews.author: ashlizrake

customer_reviews.title: I love it ❤
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! Got to organize my pans, looks cute and will buy more hooks, it came with 6 hooks but there is space for more. The would it had been better if the shelf was wider but I just place my smallest pots on top of shelf and it looks great! It was easy to assembled!
customer_reviews.author: ga

customer_reviews.title: I get lots of compliments on it and love the functionality it gives my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This was the prefect rack for my kitchen. I get lots of compliments on it and love the functionality it gives my kitchen. I purchased the two additional swivel hooks recommended by previous customers and really didn't need or like them. I prefer the stationary hooks, but I needed the additional hooks for the best use of the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good looking and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great for a house with a small space! We use this on the wall of a rental and it was just what we were looking for to take storage out of the cabinets!
customer_reviews.author: MBHE

customer_reviews.title: SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Don't know what other people are complaining about. It looks and works great. The screws they supply are to short but that only recwired a trip to homedepot for longer ones well worth the b S. Quality.I am glad i went with my gut Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: bernie baehr

customer_reviews.title: This product was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to install, and looks exactly like the image!! Right now, it's holding 5 of my pots and pans. The shelf above can fit my medium size crock pot and rice-cooker for storage. I only wish that the "hooks" didn't pop out and interfere with the space on top of the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Claire McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold very much
customer_reviews.text: Plenty sturdy and easy to assemble but the shelf is only about 6" deep and the round tops of the hooks prevented me from putting very much on top. It's a lot cheaper than other pot racks on the market, the cheaper for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine J

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I anticipated the shelf being wider, but am otherwise pleased with this pot rack. It's a little difficult to use the shelf without interference from the hooks that rest on it. Assembly would have been easier with some quick illustrated instructions, but still didn't take long to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Arpie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: work as described - easy to install, been holding up ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Classy looking.
customer_reviews.text: This looks so nice hanging on the wall and opened up a great deal of storage space. I haven't purchased more of the hangars finding that I have plenty as shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Reikigirl

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. It's good looking and functional. It was easy to hang and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: jesse sherman

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own screws/brackets to install
customer_reviews.text: The screws that are included to install are a joke, not to mention the downward angle of the top screws were a pain but all in all we got it put together and hung. All 6 hooks swivel and it seems to hold a lot. My husband is excited!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drooled over it at a friend's house and had to buy
customer_reviews.text: This looks so cute in my kitchen! I removed a really awful cupboard and weird backsplash and needed something to hang over my range that would be stylish and offer extra storage. I saw this in a friend's house and loved it, bought it, and love it installed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Style and functionality easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and created room in our country style kitchen. Style and functionality at its best
customer_reviews.author: S.T.Miller

customer_reviews.title: Dads like this product.
customer_reviews.text: "Give it 5 stars --I like it!" -my dad. This is actually the second time he has bought this product in his life. The first time he left it mounted at an old apartment and had regretted it ever since. It is "not perfect, but is a good product for the money" -also my dad. Straight forward assembly, simple and stylish. Arrived in a couple of days, no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been hanging in our kitchen for about a year (maybe more) and we love it. It looks good, is crazy sturdy (holds all my cast iron), and we get lots of compliments on it. I rarely search for past orders to review, but I love this thing so much I made an exception.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, and Strong
customer_reviews.text: I love my new pot rack... Looks really well made, and is very sturdy, I was pleasantly surprised. I purchased an extra pair of hooks, as I have many fry pans to hang. It holds 3 saucepans and 5 fry pans in my kitchen, and looks really nice, I've gotten many compliments on it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Great look and holds more than enough kitchen ware
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. looks great and i dont worry about it failing. but make sure you know what you are doing when you put this thing up because the safety of your kitchenware and those inside are completely dependent on the fasteners you use and your preparation when you install it. it does come with suitable fasteners for most installation situations but not all.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Hi he hooks that hold whatever you are hanging create an uneven surface for whatever is on the shelf. Descent product but may as well spend a bit more money and get a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Kieran O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: I like it, we had to cut it down to ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, we had to cut it down to size is it was too long for a spot above my counter, but it looks nice. We had to rub it with coarse steel wool to make it match My stainless steel refrigerator
customer_reviews.author: 30 Weight

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice, too
customer_reviews.text: Works well, durable, and holds my whole set of pots and pans. I did buy some extra hooks though. It looks nice, too. I have received many compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica J.

customer_reviews.title: A decent wall mount pot rack.
customer_reviews.text: Modern look. A word of caution: the hooks are suspended by a large cylindrical slab that holds it above the slats. This can be an issue if you're attempting to store pots right-side-up like in the product image, because the hook slabs will be in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Kodlee Yin

product_meta.title: Cooks Standard Wall Mounted Wooden Pot Rack, 36 by 8-Inch
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1| Size:36 by 8-InchThe Cooks Standard Wall Mounted Wooden Pot Rack, 36 by 8-Inch has a 36 inch base that is made of 6 wood tracks and is held by 2 (8 inch) wall mounts. The pot rack also comes with 4 pan hooks and 2 swivel hooks. Supports around 30 pounds. Brackets and hooks are made of solid cast aluminum for a modern appearance and to coordinate with your kitchen and cookware’s style. Natural wood track is smooth and durable. Cookware can be placed vertically or horizontally to save space and helps with organization. Installation is easy. Extra hooks are available, please purchase separately.
feature_bullets: Has a 36 inch base that is made of 6 wood tracks and is held by 2 wall mounts
Includes 6 swivel hooks that rotate 360 degrees; Supports around 30 pounds
Brackets/hooks are made of solid cast aluminum to match kitchen style/cookware
Natural wood track is durable and smooth; Can place cookware flat and vertically
Easy installation with phillips screwdriver; Extra hooks available, purchase separately

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
